meanings.definition: Gradually increasing in loudness or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The crescendoing music filled the room with a growing sound.
meanings.sent2: The band played a crescendoing tune that got louder and louder.
meanings.sent3: The crescendoing applause made the performer blush with joy.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a crescendoing wave crashing over her.
meanings.sent5: The crescendoing storm approached, rumbling in the distance.

meanings.definition: Reaching a peak in volume or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The crescendoing cheers of the crowd echoed through the stadium.
meanings.sent2: The movie built up to a crescendoing climax that left everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent3: The crescendoing laughter at the joke was contagious.
meanings.sent4: His anger rose like a crescendoing fire, burning brighter with each word.
meanings.sent5: The crescendoing excitement before the big game was palpable in the air.

meanings.sent1: The crescendoing of the music added drama to the performance.
meanings.sent2: The crescendoing of the waves against the shore created a soothing rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The crescendoing of the argument reached a peak and then suddenly stopped.
meanings.sent4: The crescendoing of the engine signaled the start of the race.
meanings.sent5: The crescendoing of the wind in the trees sounded like a symphony of nature.
